definition: to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: But those justifications have an incontestable value in their own day.
sentences.chinese: 但是這些辯解在當時卻具有必要的意義。

sentences.english: The company also defended the sacking-by-text message(10) as a way to keep the modern.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司還辯解到，短信解聘也是跟上時代的做法。

sentences.english: That nurse should not plead inexperience in excuse of her mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那個護士不應該藉口缺乏經驗來爲她的錯誤辯解。

sentences.english: There was no fault on our part, " defended a senior official at the Vijayawada station."
sentences.chinese: 維傑亞瓦達站的一位高級官員辯解道。

sentences.english: Brown said the allegations were "absolutely without foundation".
sentences.chinese: 布朗說這種辯解“完全沒有根據”。

sentences.english: Then, the onus is on the rumormonger to explain themselves.
sentences.chinese: 於是造謠者就有義務爲自己辯解。

sentences.english: When I argue or explain something, I do it in lists.
sentences.chinese: 當我要辯解或解釋什麼時，我也會用清單。

sentences.english: The police are suspicious of his alibi because he already has a record.
sentences.chinese: 警方對他不在場的辯解表示懷疑，因爲他已有前科。

sentences.english: Britain's Foreign Office defended the decision to send Gass to the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 英國外交部爲派遣Gass出席典禮進行辯解。

sentences.english: How would you exculpate for them?
Follin's justification for stealing was that his family were starving.
sentences.chinese: 福林爲自己偷竊辯解的理由是他的家人正在捱餓。

sentences.english: This argument is only too blatantly an alibi for domestic repression.
sentences.chinese: 這一辯解完全是在爲國內的鎮壓活動開脫。

sentences.english: I am not suggesting I sympathise with him, nor excuse him, I certainly don't.
sentences.chinese: 這並不說明我同情他或者爲他辯解，我當然不會。

sentences.english: He exculpated himself from stealing the money.
sentences.chinese: 他爲自己辯解沒有偷錢。

sentences.english: The white man began stating reasons why he should get all the turkeys for himself. But the American Indian stopped him.
sentences.chinese: 這個白人開始爲自己爲何應該得到所有的火雞而辯解。

sentences.english: Do not apologise for these needs.
sentences.chinese: 不要爲這樣的需求辯解。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to speak in defense of/to argue in favor of/to defend/to plead
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
